intro: Mascagnia tenuis, commonly known as the slender mascagnia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, evergreen leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in drought-tolerant gardens.
